title: The best wireless headphones to buy in 2019
text:
If you're sick of untangling headphone wires, it could be time to give wireless a go.

With over-ear, on-ear, and in-ear headphones available, there's a lot to choose from, but it all depends on what you'll be using them for.

Whether you want to block the sound out on your commute, wear them when you're running, or turn up the volume and rock out at home, we've selected the best wireless headphones on the market right now.

Sony WH-1000XM3 noise-cancelling headphones, £268

These noise-cancelling headphones are said to be even better than Bose. A favourite on the headphones market, they have a battery life of 30 hours and a wireless range of 30 feet.

There's also a Quick Attention feature that lets in outside noise when you want it, without taking the headphones off. The improved design makes them even more comfortable and lightweight to wear.

If you're after style as well as sound quality, these mid-range headphones are an excellent all-round choice for guaranteed quality.





Buy now on Amazon

Urbanista Stockholm ear pods, £89



If you prefer discreet ear pods rather than over-ear headphones, these could be the ones for you. Lightweight and easy to connect, they are designed to fit securely in your ear and are hardly noticeable.

As well as being perfect for using on the move, including running, they have a battery life of 3.5 hours and come in four sleek colours with a stylish charging case.





Buy now on Urbanista UK

Bose QuietComfort 25 II, £259

These upgraded headphones from Bose have Alexa and Google Assistant built in so you can do even more on the go. They feature a dual microphone system for clear phone calls and voice access to your phone's virtual assistant, such as Siri.

Already famed for their noise-cancelling technology, the headphones' new features allow you to interact with your smart device using just your voice.

You get 20 hours of wireless listening per charge and can switch between bluetooth connected devices at the click of a button by downloading the free Bose Connect app.





Buy now on Amazon

Jabra Elite 65t In-Ear with Mic/Remote, £125

These durable in-ear headphones offer high quality sound as well as crystal clear phone calls.

Switch between music and setting appointments, finding nearby events, or having messages read back to you with their voice command technology.

They have a battery life of five hours and come with a charging carry case which will give you more juice in just 15 minutes if you run out.





Buy now on John Lewis

Sennheiser Momentum True Wireless, £269.99

These are the first wire-free earphones from Sennheiser and are a little larger than Apple's AirPods or the Jabra Elite 65T. However, they are still comfortable and won't fall out of your ears, even when running.

One for the tech-savvy, these headphones come with two microphones in each earpiece to separate your voice from ambient noise, and are rated excellent for sound quality.

They have a sophisticated look and come with an attractive grey case with an in-built in battery.





Buy now on Argos

Beats by Dr. Dre Solo3 £199



Perfect for workouts as well as your commute, these sleek over-ear headphones from the Dr. Dre range look great as well as offering superb sound.

They come in a range of colours, from citrus red and rose gold, to gloss black and pop blue, and offer 40 hours of battery life for multi-day use. Fast Fuel five minutes of charging also gives you three hours of playback when battery is low.

The sleek, streamlined design is durable and foldable. There is also a multi-function control so you can take calls and activate Siri as well as listen to music.

Buy now on Amazon

Beyerdynamic Amiron Wireless, £486

These top-of-the-range over-ear headphones are pricey, but worth it for the sound quality.

Consistently voted one of the best wireless headphones, they are designed to feel extra comfortable over your ears, making them easy to wear for hours on end.

With more than 30 hours of battery life, these are the headphones to opt for if you want the best sound. The headphones come with a hard case, USB wire to charge them, and a connecting wire with an in-built remote control should you want to switch if the battery drains.





Buy now on Amazon

Samsung AKG N60NC, £269

A good mid-range option, these on-ear wireless headphones offer excellent sound quality and noise cancelling.

They come in a flat and foldable design, which makes them easy to carry around, and have a long battery life, with up to 15 hours of playback. Much better looking than some of their competitors, they also come with a carrying case.





Buy now on Samsung

Marshall Monitor Bluetooth, £136

These rock-inspired headphones combine hi-fi performance with Bluetooth aptX technology to offer superb audio quality.

With a black vinyl and brass accent in the classic Marshall design, they look great, and are foldable so are perfect for your commute.

The ergonomic over-ear construction provides excellent noise isolation without being bulky and feels light on the ears, which is good as these have a playback of 30 hours from a single charge. There's also a socket so you can share audio with friends.





Buy now on Amazon

Creative Super X-Fi Air, £149.99

These headphones are next level, despite the relatively affordable price tag. They work by using clever technology which adapts the headphones to your ears.

This changes the whole listening experience, and is why they were recently praised at the Consumer Electronics Show. There is also the option to add a memory card so you can listen to music without being connected to Bluetooth.

If you're after rock star sound and phone calls so clear it sounds like the person is in the room, these are the headphones for you.

Buy now on Creative

Master & Dynamic MW07, £279

These premium-look higher-range ear pods come in a sleek marble design, with a range of colours to choose from such as cherry blossom, grey terrazo and piano black.

Despite their small size, they are heavy on sound and easily stay in your ears, even if you're dancing around. Five sets of ear tips mean you can customise the fit and comfort based on your ear size.

Two pairs of silicone wings add an extra level of security to how they fit. Their battery life may not be the longest, but their audio and aesthetic certainly make up for it.





Buy now on Amazon

Jaybird run XT In-Ear, £159

Best for sporty types, particularly runners, these are the second 'true wireless' offering from Jaybird Sport.

Fully waterproof and sweatproof, these lightweight ear pods are designed for all terrains. The in-ear design also comes with a range of different tips and wings for added comfort.





Buy now on Jaybird Sport
